From: "Nic Ferrier" <nferrier@...>
>
> It's my belief that basic authentication could be fixed as a device
> for doing web authentication if the user agents always displayed the
> entity from the server.

Except that entity already has a use:  to be displayed if the user hits the
cancel button.  An alternative might be to provide a new response header
during challenges that points a browser to a server-defined skin (possibly
using the technique S. Mike found in the W3C Note).  Newer browsers that
recognized the header would  be able to give a more "polished" look, while
older browsers would continue working without problem.

---
Seairth Jacobs
